pages.text: Scanning and Researching isn't completely trial and error. The Tech Tree, found in the e-scanner, can help you determine what new technologies are available to find.$(br2)The tech tree shows $(thing)Production 1$() (black) as blinking. This means the blueprint can be scanned and researched.

Notice that its also connected to the Techtable. If you scan the Techtable, you should find the blueprint for 'Production 1'$(br2)There are two types of blueprints, concepts and technology. Using the process just described, technology can be easily found and scanned.$(br2)Concepts are a bit harder to track down, requiring you to scan and research any item which was unlock in any adjoining concept, to find the needed blueprint.

There are also multiple tech trees, each one a different category of new technologies to discover.$(br2)Sometimes researching a blueprint in one tech tree unlocks possible research in another. $(br2)Concepts are always listed under $(thing)Story$(), and can be researched from any technology in any category.
